intro: Lathyrus bolanderi subsp. quercetorum, commonly known as the Bolander's vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb with climbing stems that produce clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and is adapted to grow in rocky or dry environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes known for nitrogen-fixing abilities. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
